Class PcscMigCardTerminal

java.lang.Object

public class PcscMigCardTerminal
extends opencard.core.terminal.CardTerminal
implements PcscMigConstants, opencard.opt.terminal.PowerManagementInterface, opencard.opt.terminal.TerminalCommand, opencard.core.terminal.Pollable

Implementation of an OpenCard CardTerminal for PCSC.

isCardPresent

public boolean isCardPresent(int slot)
                      throws opencard.core.terminal.CardTerminalException
Check whether there is a smart card present.
Parameters:
slot - Number of the slot to check (must be 0 for PCSC)
Returns:
True if there is a smart card inserted in the card terminals slot.

getCardID

public opencard.core.terminal.CardID getCardID(int slot)
                                        throws opencard.core.terminal.CardTerminalException
Return the CardID of the presently inserted card. Will returned the cached card if slot's status has not changed; otherwise it will really retrieve the CardID.

Parameters:
slot - slot number
Returns:
A CardID object representing the inserted smart card.
Throws:
opencard.core.terminal.CardTerminalException - thrown when problem occured getting the ATR of the card
Overrides:
getCardID in class opencard.core.terminal.CardTerminal

                                               int timeout)
                                        throws opencard.core.terminal.CardTerminalException
Return the CardID of the presently inserted card. Will returned the cached card if slot's status has not changed; otherwise it will really retrieve the CardID.

Parameters:
slot - slot number
timeout - timeout in seconds
Returns:
A CardID object representing the inserted smart card.
Throws:
opencard.core.terminal.CardTerminalException - thrown when problem occured getting the ATR of the card
Overrides:
getCardID in class opencard.core.terminal.CardTerminal

powerUpCard

public void powerUpCard(int slot,
                        int timeout)
                 throws opencard.core.terminal.CardTerminalException
Power up a card. If the card was already powered up it is resetted.
Specified by:
powerUpCard in interface opencard.opt.terminal.PowerManagementInterface
Parameters:
timeout - The time to wait before returning (in s); -1 signals an indefinite timeout (i.e., wait forever).
Throws:
opencard.core.terminal.CardTerminalException - Thrown when no card is present.
See Also:
PowerManagementInterface

poll

          throws opencard.core.terminal.CardTerminalException
